p: It has been shown that 69 compounds obtained from plants demonstrate activity against Candida biofilms ( Table 2). Among these, the most common are monotherpenes (20), followed by sesquiterpene lactones (7) and sesquiterpenes (6). Another big group is also phenolic compounds, including phenols (6), phenolic acids (5), phenolic aldehydes (2), polyphenols (2), and phenolic alcohol (1).
